# BAZINGA Dashboard 2.0: Complete Database-Driven Dashboard

**Date:** 2025-11-26
**Context:** Replacing vanilla JS dashboard with modern Next.js database-driven dashboard
**Decision:** Build comprehensive orchestration monitoring and analytics platform
**Status:** Proposed

---

## Executive Summary

Build a next-generation dashboard that transforms raw orchestration data into actionable insights. The new dashboard will provide:
- **Real-time orchestration monitoring** with WebSocket updates
- **Historical session analysis** with deep-dive capabilities
- **AI-powered insights** for pattern detection and recommendations
- **State machine visualizations** showing workflow progression
- **Token economics tracking** for cost optimization

---

## Problem Statement

The current dashboard has significant limitations:
1. **Vanilla JS architecture** - No component framework, hard to maintain
2. **Limited historical views** - Can't effectively browse past sessions
3. **AI features disabled** - Requires manual enablement
4. **No analytics** - Raw data without insights
5. **Manual DOM manipulation** - Error-prone and slow
6. **No type safety** - JavaScript without TypeScript
7. **Poor state management** - Ad-hoc data flow

---

## Feature & Functionality List

### ğŸ¯ Core Features

#### 1. **Session Command Center** (Priority: Critical)
- Real-time session monitoring with live updates
- Session timeline with agent activity visualization
- Quick session switcher with search/filter
- Session comparison view (side-by-side)
- Session templates for common orchestration patterns

#### 2. **Historical Session Explorer** (Priority: Critical)
- Paginated session list with infinite scroll
- Advanced filtering (date range, status, duration, token usage)
- Full-text search across session logs
- Session grouping by project/tags
- Export sessions to JSON/PDF reports
- Session archival and restoration

#### 3. **Agent Activity Monitor** (Priority: Critical)
- Live agent status cards (who's working on what)
- Agent communication timeline
- Agent-to-agent message flow visualization
- Status code history per agent
- Model tier tracking (Haiku â†’ Sonnet â†’ Opus escalations)

#### 4. **Task Group Management** (Priority: High)
- Kanban-style task board (Pending â†’ In Progress â†’ QA â†’ Review â†’ Done)
- Task group detail panels with full history
- Dependency graph visualization
- Revision tracking with diff views
- Risk scoring heat map

#### 5. **Workflow State Machine Visualization** (Priority: High)
- Interactive state machine diagram
- Current state highlighting
- Transition history with timestamps
- Phase progression indicator
- Parallel execution swimlanes

#### 6. **Token Economics Dashboard** (Priority: High)
- Real-time token consumption meter
- Token breakdown by agent type (pie chart)
- Token timeline (area chart)
- Cost estimation with model pricing
- Budget alerts and thresholds
- Model escalation impact analysis

#### 7. **Quality Metrics Hub** (Priority: High)
- Success criteria checklist (interactive)
- Test coverage trends (line chart)
- Security scan results summary
- Lint issue tracking
- Tech Lead review decisions analytics
- Quality score over time

#### 8. **AI-Powered Insights Engine** (Priority: Medium-High)
- Automatic session summaries
- Pattern detection across sessions
- Anomaly detection (unusual token usage, long cycles)
- Recommendations for optimization
- Predictive completion estimates
- Natural language query interface ("Show me failed sessions from last week")

#### 9. **Investigation Tracker** (Priority: Medium)
- Investigation timeline visualization
- Hypothesis matrix display
- Root cause analysis tree
- Solution validation tracking
- Investigation success rate metrics

#### 10. **Velocity & Performance Analytics** (Priority: Medium)
- Velocity trend charts (story points/time)
- Cycle time analysis
- Revision rate tracking
- Efficiency comparisons
- 99% rule violation alerts
- Bottleneck identification

#### 11. **Notification Center** (Priority: Medium)
- In-app notification feed
- Browser push notifications
- Email integration (session completion, failures)
- Slack webhook integration
- Custom alert rules

#### 12. **Settings & Configuration** (Priority: Low)
- Theme customization (dark/light/system)
- Dashboard layout preferences
- Data refresh intervals
- Export/import configuration
- API key management
- User preferences persistence

---

### ğŸš€ Advanced Features

#### 13. **Session Replay Mode**
- Step-through session execution
- Playback controls (play, pause, speed)
- Jump to specific timestamp
- Annotation capability
- Share replay links

#### 14. **Multi-Session Analytics**
- Cross-session pattern analysis
- Session comparison matrix
- Aggregate metrics dashboard
- Trend analysis over time
- Project-level rollup views

#### 15. **Custom Dashboards**
- Drag-and-drop widget placement
- Save custom layouts
- Share dashboards with team
- Widget library
- Custom metric definitions

#### 16. **API & Integrations**
- REST API for external access
- Webhook subscriptions
- GitHub integration (link sessions to PRs)
- Jira/Linear integration
- Custom data export schedules

---

### Database Schema (Drizzle ORM)

```typescript
// src/lib/db/schema.ts

import { sqliteTable, text, integer, real } from 'drizzle-orm/sqlite-core';

export const sessions = sqliteTable('sessions', {
  id: text('id').primaryKey(),
  sessionId: text('session_id').notNull().unique(),
  startTime: text('start_time').notNull(),
  endTime: text('end_time'),
  status: text('status').notNull().default('active'),
  mode: text('mode').default('simple'),
  originalRequirements: text('original_requirements'),
  developerCount: integer('developer_count').default(1),
  createdAt: text('created_at').notNull(),
  updatedAt: text('updated_at').notNull(),
});

export const orchestrationLogs = sqliteTable('orchestration_logs', {
  id: integer('id').primaryKey({ autoIncrement: true }),
  sessionId: text('session_id').notNull().references(() => sessions.sessionId),
  timestamp: text('timestamp').notNull(),
  iteration: integer('iteration').default(0),
  agentType: text('agent_type').notNull(),
  agentId: text('agent_id'),
  content: text('content').notNull(),
  statusCode: text('status_code'),
  tokensUsed: integer('tokens_used'),
  modelTier: text('model_tier'),
});

export const taskGroups = sqliteTable('task_groups', {
  id: integer('id').primaryKey({ autoIncrement: true }),
  sessionId: text('session_id').notNull().references(() => sessions.sessionId),
  groupId: text('group_id').notNull(),
  name: text('name').notNull(),
  status: text('status').notNull().default('pending'),
  assignedTo: text('assigned_to'),
  revisionCount: integer('revision_count').default(0),
  complexity: integer('complexity'),
  initialTier: text('initial_tier'),
  currentStage: text('current_stage').default('pending'),
  lastReviewStatus: text('last_review_status'),
  riskScore: real('risk_score'),
  createdAt: text('created_at').notNull(),
  updatedAt: text('updated_at').notNull(),
});

export const tokenUsage = sqliteTable('token_usage', {
  id: integer('id').primaryKey({ autoIncrement: true }),
  sessionId: text('session_id').notNull().references(() => sessions.sessionId),
  timestamp: text('timestamp').notNull(),
  agentType: text('agent_type').notNull(),
  agentId: text('agent_id'),
  modelTier: text('model_tier').notNull(),
  tokensUsed: integer('tokens_used').notNull(),
  estimatedCost: real('estimated_cost'),
});

export const successCriteria = sqliteTable('success_criteria', {
  id: integer('id').primaryKey({ autoIncrement: true }),
  sessionId: text('session_id').notNull().references(() => sessions.sessionId),
  criterion: text('criterion').notNull(),
  status: text('status').notNull().default('pending'),
  actual: text('actual'),
  evidence: text('evidence'),
  requiredForCompletion: integer('required_for_completion').default(1),
  verifiedAt: text('verified_at'),
});

export const stateSnapshots = sqliteTable('state_snapshots', {
  id: integer('id').primaryKey({ autoIncrement: true }),
  sessionId: text('session_id').notNull().references(() => sessions.sessionId),
  timestamp: text('timestamp').notNull(),
  snapshotType: text('snapshot_type').notNull(),
  data: text('data').notNull(), // JSON
});

export const qualityMetrics = sqliteTable('quality_metrics', {
  id: integer('id').primaryKey({ autoIncrement: true }),
  sessionId: text('session_id').notNull().references(() => sessions.sessionId),
  timestamp: text('timestamp').notNull(),
  metricType: text('metric_type').notNull(),
  value: real('value').notNull(),
  details: text('details'), // JSON
});
```

### API Routes (tRPC)

```typescript
// src/lib/trpc/routers/sessions.ts

import { z } from 'zod';
import { router, publicProcedure } from '../server';
import { db } from '../../db/client';
import { sessions, taskGroups, orchestrationLogs } from '../../db/schema';
import { desc, eq, and, gte, lte } from 'drizzle-orm';

export const sessionsRouter = router({
  // Get all sessions with pagination and filters
  list: publicProcedure
    .input(z.object({
      limit: z.number().min(1).max(100).default(20),
      cursor: z.string().optional(),
      status: z.enum(['all', 'active', 'completed', 'failed']).default('all'),
      dateFrom: z.string().optional(),
      dateTo: z.string().optional(),
      search: z.string().optional(),
    }))
    .query(async ({ input }) => {
      const conditions = [];

      if (input.status !== 'all') {
        conditions.push(eq(sessions.status, input.status));
      }
      if (input.dateFrom) {
        conditions.push(gte(sessions.startTime, input.dateFrom));
      }
      if (input.dateTo) {
        conditions.push(lte(sessions.startTime, input.dateTo));
      }

      const results = await db.query.sessions.findMany({
        where: conditions.length > 0 ? and(...conditions) : undefined,
        orderBy: [desc(sessions.startTime)],
        limit: input.limit + 1,
        with: {
          taskGroups: true,
        },
      });

      return {
        sessions: results.slice(0, input.limit),
        nextCursor: results.length > input.limit ? results[input.limit].id : null,
      };
    }),

  // Get single session with all details
  getById: publicProcedure
    .input(z.object({ sessionId: z.string() }))
    .query(async ({ input }) => {
      const session = await db.query.sessions.findFirst({
        where: eq(sessions.sessionId, input.sessionId),
        with: {
          taskGroups: true,
          orchestrationLogs: {
            orderBy: [desc(orchestrationLogs.timestamp)],
            limit: 100,
          },
          successCriteria: true,
          stateSnapshots: {
            orderBy: [desc(stateSnapshots.timestamp)],
            limit: 10,
          },
        },
      });

      return session;
    }),

  // Get session statistics
  getStats: publicProcedure
    .input(z.object({
      dateFrom: z.string().optional(),
      dateTo: z.string().optional(),
    }))
    .query(async ({ input }) => {
      // Aggregate statistics
      const stats = await db.select({
        totalSessions: count(),
        completedSessions: count(eq(sessions.status, 'completed')),
        failedSessions: count(eq(sessions.status, 'failed')),
        activeSessions: count(eq(sessions.status, 'active')),
      }).from(sessions);

      return stats[0];
    }),
});
```

### Real-time Updates (Socket.io)

```typescript
// src/lib/socket/server.ts

import { Server } from 'socket.io';
import { db } from '../db/client';
import { sessions, orchestrationLogs } from '../db/schema';

export function initializeSocketServer(httpServer: any) {
  const io = new Server(httpServer, {
    cors: {
      origin: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL,
      methods: ['GET', 'POST'],
    },
  });

  // Watch database for changes
  const watchInterval = setInterval(async () => {
    const activeSessions = await db.query.sessions.findMany({
      where: eq(sessions.status, 'active'),
    });

    for (const session of activeSessions) {
      const latestLogs = await db.query.orchestrationLogs.findMany({
        where: eq(orchestrationLogs.sessionId, session.sessionId),
        orderBy: [desc(orchestrationLogs.timestamp)],
        limit: 10,
      });

      io.to(`session:${session.sessionId}`).emit('session:update', {
        session,
        latestLogs,
      });
    }
  }, 2000); // Poll every 2 seconds

  io.on('connection', (socket) => {
    console.log('Client connected:', socket.id);

    socket.on('subscribe:session', (sessionId: string) => {
      socket.join(`session:${sessionId}`);
    });

    socket.on('unsubscribe:session', (sessionId: string) => {
      socket.leave(`session:${sessionId}`);
    });

    socket.on('disconnect', () => {
      console.log('Client disconnected:', socket.id);
    });
  });

  return io;
}
```

### AI Insights Engine

```typescript
// src/lib/ai/insights.ts

import Anthropic from '@anthropic-ai/sdk';
import { db } from '../db/client';

const anthropic = new Anthropic();

export async function generateSessionSummary(sessionId: string): Promise<string> {
  const session = await db.query.sessions.findFirst({
    where: eq(sessions.sessionId, sessionId),
    with: {
      taskGroups: true,
      orchestrationLogs: { limit: 50 },
      successCriteria: true,
    },
  });

  if (!session) throw new Error('Session not found');

  const prompt = `Analyze this orchestration session and provide a concise summary:

Session ID: ${session.sessionId}
Status: ${session.status}
Mode: ${session.mode}
Requirements: ${session.originalRequirements}

Task Groups:
${session.taskGroups.map(g => `- ${g.name}: ${g.status} (revisions: ${g.revisionCount})`).join('\n')}

Success Criteria:
${session.successCriteria.map(c => `- ${c.criterion}: ${c.status}`).join('\n')}

Recent Activity (last 10 logs):
${session.orchestrationLogs.slice(0, 10).map(l => `[${l.agentType}] ${l.statusCode || 'working'}`).join('\n')}

Provide:
1. A 2-3 sentence summary of what's happening
2. Estimated completion time (if active)
3. Any concerns or patterns noticed
4. Confidence level (%)`;

  const response = await anthropic.messages.create({
    model: 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514',
    max_tokens: 500,
    messages: [{ role: 'user', content: prompt }],
  });

  return response.content[0].type === 'text' ? response.content[0].text : '';
}

export async function detectPatterns(sessionId: string): Promise<Pattern[]> {
  // Analyze revision patterns, token usage anomalies, etc.
  const logs = await db.query.orchestrationLogs.findMany({
    where: eq(orchestrationLogs.sessionId, sessionId),
  });

  const patterns: Pattern[] = [];

  // Detect high revision count
  const taskGroups = await db.query.taskGroups.findMany({
    where: eq(taskGroups.sessionId, sessionId),
  });

  for (const group of taskGroups) {
    if (group.revisionCount >= 2) {
      patterns.push({
        type: 'revision_pattern',
        severity: group.revisionCount >= 3 ? 'high' : 'medium',
        message: `${group.name} has ${group.revisionCount} revisions`,
        recommendation: 'Consider adding validation checkpoints',
      });
    }
  }

  // Detect model escalations
  const escalations = logs.filter(l => l.content?.includes('escalat'));
  if (escalations.length > 0) {
    patterns.push({
      type: 'escalation',
      severity: 'info',
      message: `${escalations.length} model escalation(s) detected`,
      recommendation: 'Review complexity assignments',
    });
  }

  return patterns;
}

export async function answerQuestion(
  sessionId: string,
  question: string
): Promise<string> {
  const session = await db.query.sessions.findFirst({
    where: eq(sessions.sessionId, sessionId),
    with: {
      taskGroups: true,
      orchestrationLogs: true,
      successCriteria: true,
      tokenUsage: true,
    },
  });

  const prompt = `You are an AI assistant analyzing an orchestration session.

Session Data:
${JSON.stringify(session, null, 2)}

User Question: ${question}

Provide a helpful, concise answer based on the session data.`;

  const response = await anthropic.messages.create({
    model: 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514',
    max_tokens: 300,
    messages: [{ role: 'user', content: prompt }],
  });

  return response.content[0].type === 'text' ? response.content[0].text : '';
}
```

### State Machine Visualization (XState)

```typescript
// src/machines/workflowMachine.ts

import { createMachine, assign } from 'xstate';

export const workflowMachine = createMachine({
  id: 'orchestration',
  initial: 'initialization',
  context: {
    sessionId: null,
    taskGroups: [],
    currentPhase: 0,
    completedGroups: [],
  },
  states: {
    initialization: {
      on: {
        START: 'planning',
      },
    },
    planning: {
      on: {
        PLANNING_COMPLETE: 'execution',
        NEEDS_CLARIFICATION: 'clarification',
      },
    },
    clarification: {
      on: {
        CLARIFIED: 'planning',
      },
    },
    execution: {
      initial: 'parallel',
      states: {
        parallel: {
          type: 'parallel',
          states: {
            groupA: {
              initial: 'development',
              states: {
                development: {
                  on: { READY_FOR_QA: 'qa' },
                },
                qa: {
                  on: {
                    QA_PASS: 'review',
                    QA_FAIL: 'development',
                  },
                },
                review: {
                  on: {
                    APPROVED: 'complete',
                    CHANGES_REQUESTED: 'development',
                  },
                },
                complete: { type: 'final' },
              },
            },
            groupB: {
              // Similar structure
            },
            groupC: {
              // Similar structure
            },
          },
        },
      },
      on: {
        ALL_GROUPS_COMPLETE: 'completion',
      },
    },
    completion: {
      on: {
        BAZINGA: 'success',
        VALIDATION_FAILED: 'execution',
      },
    },
    success: {
      type: 'final',
    },
  },
});
```

### Component Example: Workflow Visualization

```typescript
// src/components/dashboard/WorkflowStateMachine.tsx

'use client';

import { useMemo } from 'react';
import ReactFlow, {
  Node,
  Edge,
  Background,
  Controls,
  MiniMap,
} from 'reactflow';
import 'reactflow/dist/style.css';

interface WorkflowStateMachineProps {
  session: Session;
  taskGroups: TaskGroup[];
}

export function WorkflowStateMachine({ session, taskGroups }: WorkflowStateMachineProps) {
  const { nodes, edges } = useMemo(() => {
    const nodes: Node[] = [
      {
        id: 'init',
        type: 'custom',
        position: { x: 0, y: 100 },
        data: {
          label: 'INIT',
          status: session.status === 'active' ? 'completed' : 'active',
        },
      },
      {
        id: 'planning',
        type: 'custom',
        position: { x: 200, y: 100 },
        data: {
          label: 'PLANNING',
          status: determineStatus('planning', session),
        },
      },
      {
        id: 'execution',
        type: 'custom',
        position: { x: 400, y: 100 },
        data: {
          label: 'EXECUTION',
          status: determineStatus('execution', session),
        },
      },
      {
        id: 'complete',
        type: 'custom',
        position: { x: 600, y: 100 },
        data: {
          label: 'COMPLETE',
          status: session.status === 'completed' ? 'active' : 'pending',
        },
      },
    ];

    // Add task group nodes
    taskGroups.forEach((group, index) => {
      nodes.push({
        id: `group-${group.groupId}`,
        type: 'taskGroup',
        position: { x: 400 + (index % 2) * 150, y: 250 + Math.floor(index / 2) * 100 },
        data: {
          label: group.name,
          status: group.status,
          stage: group.currentStage,
          revisions: group.revisionCount,
        },
      });
    });

    const edges: Edge[] = [
      { id: 'e1', source: 'init', target: 'planning', animated: true },
      { id: 'e2', source: 'planning', target: 'execution', animated: true },
      { id: 'e3', source: 'execution', target: 'complete', animated: true },
    ];

    // Add edges from execution to task groups
    taskGroups.forEach((group) => {
      edges.push({
        id: `e-exec-${group.groupId}`,
        source: 'execution',
        target: `group-${group.groupId}`,
        style: { strokeDasharray: '5,5' },
      });
    });

    return { nodes, edges };
  }, [session, taskGroups]);

  return (
    <div className="h-[400px] w-full rounded-lg border bg-card">
      <ReactFlow
        nodes={nodes}
        edges={edges}
        nodeTypes={nodeTypes}
        fitView
        attributionPosition="bottom-left"
      >
        <Background />
        <Controls />
        <MiniMap />
      </ReactFlow>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Critical Analysis

### Pros âœ…

1. **Modern Tech Stack** - Next.js 14 with App Router is production-ready and performant
2. **Type Safety** - TypeScript + Drizzle ORM + tRPC = end-to-end type safety
3. **Real-time First** - Socket.io provides instant updates without polling
4. **AI-Native** - Built-in Claude integration for intelligent insights
5. **Database-Driven** - All data from SQLite, no file dependencies
6. **Component Architecture** - shadcn/ui provides consistent, accessible components
7. **State Machine Visualization** - XState + React Flow for clear workflow display
8. **Scalable** - Can handle hundreds of sessions efficiently

### Cons âš ï¸

1. **Complexity** - More moving parts than vanilla JS dashboard
2. **Build Step Required** - No more "just open index.html"
3. **Learning Curve** - Team needs to know React/Next.js ecosystem
4. **Initial Development Time** - 4-5 weeks vs existing dashboard
5. **AI Costs** - Claude API calls add operational cost

### Verdict

The benefits significantly outweigh the costs. The new dashboard will be:
- **More maintainable** - Component architecture vs monolithic JS
- **More feature-rich** - AI insights, state machines, real-time
- **More reliable** - Type safety catches bugs early
- **Better UX** - Modern React patterns, smooth animations
- **Future-proof** - Easy to extend with new features

---

## Comparison to Alternatives

| Feature | Current (Vanilla JS) | Next.js Dashboard | Grafana + Custom |
|---------|---------------------|-------------------|------------------|
| Type Safety | âŒ None | âœ… Full | âš ï¸ Partial |
| Real-time | âš ï¸ WebSocket+Polling | âœ… Socket.io | âœ… Built-in |
| AI Features | âš ï¸ Manual/disabled | âœ… Built-in | âŒ None |
| State Machine | âŒ None | âœ… XState | âŒ None |
| Maintenance | âš ï¸ Hard (5.5K lines) | âœ… Component-based | âš ï¸ Config-heavy |
| Custom Views | âš ï¸ Manual DOM | âœ… React components | âš ï¸ Limited |
| Historical | âŒ Limited | âœ… Full | âœ… Full |
| Setup Time | âœ… None | âš ï¸ Build required | âš ï¸ Complex |

**Winner: Next.js Dashboard** - Best balance of features, maintainability, and customization.

---

## Decision Rationale

1. **Next.js over pure React** - Server components, API routes, and file-based routing reduce boilerplate
2. **shadcn/ui over Material-UI** - Lighter, more customizable, better dark mode
3. **Drizzle over Prisma** - Better SQLite support, type-safe raw queries
4. **tRPC over REST** - End-to-end type safety without code generation
5. **Socket.io over native WS** - Better reconnection handling, room support
6. **Recharts over D3** - React-native, easier to use, good enough for our needs
7. **React Flow over Mermaid** - Interactive, customizable, better for state machines

---

## Lessons Learned (from current dashboard)

1. **Database-first is right** - The migration from files to SQLite was correct
2. **Real-time is essential** - Users expect live updates
3. **AI should be default-on** - Disabled features don't get used
4. **Component reuse matters** - 16 JS files with similar patterns = maintenance burden
5. **Type safety prevents bugs** - Many issues from dynamic typing in vanilla JS

---
